ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Curve is a type of . A Curve is the path of a point moving through its three-dimensional coordinate space or of a point moving through its two-dimensional coordinate space. A Curve shall be arc-wise connected. A Curve shall have an arc length greater than zero.
A Line is a type of that is straight. A Line is considered infinite.
A Plane is a type of that is flat. A Plane is considered infinite.

A Point_on_curve is a type of
that characterizes a point which lies on a curve. It results from the evaluation of the function that defines the with a particular parameter.
specifies the role of the for the Point_on_curve. The supporting_curve is the onto which the point is evaluated.

A Point_on_surface is a type of that characterizes a point that lies on a parametric surface. It either results from the evaluation of the function that defines the with a particular couple of parameters or from the evaluation of a point where a curve on the surface collapses.
specifies the role of the for the Point_on_surface. The supporting_surface is the on which the point lies.

A Surface is a type of
that is a continuous 2D subspace of a 3D space. A Surface may not be manifold.
The Surface entity is a supertype of various specific kinds of surfaces. The definition of these specific types is outside the scope of the present module.
